channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0732; 12:32PM; 340 S Normandie Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/449r99c; Koreatown; KNOCKDOWN: 28 firefighters held the blaze to the unit of origin and extinguished it in 11 minutes with no injuries reported. The adjacent units were defended from damage. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 29; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 E13 E229 E29 E52 E6 RA35 RA61 T29; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0732; 12:21PM; 340 S Normandie Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/449r99c; Koreatown; Three story modern, garden style, apartment building with fire showing in one unit on the top floor. Firefighters are in the offensive mode. ; FS 29; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 E13 E229 E29 E52 RA61 T29; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

Auto vs Pedestrian; INC#0405; 07:55AM; 6275 W Colgate Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/40IXDUt; #MidWilshire; A vehicle struck two pedestrians (approx 6-year-old female & 35-year-old female) and then collided with a structure (two-story apartment). The adult female was sadly found to be deceased on scene. The young girl was transported in critical condition. The driver (approx 30-year-old male) was transported in fair condition. No one was trapped. Unknown extent of damage to the structure.; FS 61; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; BC18 E261 E41 E61 E68 EM18 HR3 RA27 RA41 RA52 T61; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Update Chemical Investigation; INC#1411; 05:39AM; 2800 S Sepulveda Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/41XrHN9; #RanchoPark; PIO Captain Erik Scott will assist news media on scene with an ETA of 6:30am. MEDIA: Stage to the north of the incident at 2600 S Sepulveda Blvd x Richland.; FS 59; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 5; BC9 DP1 DT1 E59 E95 JT2 JT3 JT4 PI1 SQ95; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Update Chemical Investigation; INC#1411; 10:30PM; 2800 S Sepulveda Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/41XrHN9; #RanchoPark; Firefighters arrived to find oil coming out of the ground at a rate of approximately 3-5 gallons per minute. They urgently created dams using shovels and nearby dirt to contain the leaking oil and protect the storm drains. An estimated total of approximately 1,000 gallons made its way out of the ground. The flow has been stopped and only about 20-40 gallons escaped into the storm drain before firefighters contained the rest in the immediate area. Clean Harbors ordered a vacuum truck, Street Services delivered sand, and LAFD Heavy Equipment will respond to position the sand to provide additional material to protect the drains and the environment. Multiple oil pipes run through the area and agencies are working together to determine which line was compromised. Watershed, LA County Health Hazmat, and Clean Harbors will clean up, along with the parties on site. No injury. No further hazard. Sepulveda is shut down in both directions for an unknown duration.; FS 59; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 5; BC9 DP1 DT1 E59 E95 JT2 JT3 JT4 PI1 SQ95; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Update Chemical Investigation; INC#1411; 08:50PM; 2800 S Sepulveda Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/41XrHN9; #RanchoPark; Firefighters used soil from the side of the road to control the spread of the yet-to-be-identified "oil-like" substance that was previously seeping out of the ground. PIO Captain Erik Scott is en route, ETA 9pm.; FS 59; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 5; BC9 E59 E95 JT2 JT3 JT4 PI1 SQ95; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Chemical Investigation; INC#1411; 05:54PM; 2800 S Sepulveda Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/41XrHN9; #RanchoPark; LAFD responded to an "oil-like" substance continuously seeping from the ground. Firefighters have called for a vacuum truck and sand to mitigate the environmental effect. Several agencies have been notified (Clean Harbors, Street Services, Watershed, and possible responsible parties for the substance). There is no anticipated widespread public hazard. Motorists are encouraged to seek alternate routes.; FS 59; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 5; BC9 E59 E95 JT3 JT4 SQ95; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0606; 10:25AM; 7747 N Owensmouth Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3HcrIVD; #CanogaPark; It took 18 firefighters 16 minutes to extinguish a fully-involved RV next to a single-family home. Firefighters quickly deployed hose lines and kept the fire from spreading to the nearby home, which only sustained minor exterior damage. One elderly female resident of the RV sustained minor smoke inhalation and was treated by paramedics on scene.; FS 72; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E104 E296 E72 E93 RA107 T96; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0606; 10:09AM; 7747 N Owensmouth Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3HcrIVD; #CanogaPark; One RV is fully involved with fire, and flames are threatening a one-story single-family home.; FS 72; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E296 E72 E93 RA107 T96; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0593; 10:10AM; 9611 S Compton Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/40BJCrZ; #Watts; The first 10 LAFD firefighters, along with one engine from neighboring LA County FD, took just 7 minutes to respond and extinguish the flames consuming a vacant one-story home. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 65; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC1 E233 E264 E64 E65 RA264 RA865 T33 T64; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange
